intro: Humboltia stenostachya, commonly known as the narrow-stamen humboldtia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a compact, shrub-like structure. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate in shape, and the flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color. Humboltia stenostachya is noted for its adaptability to arid environments and its role in local ecosystems.
